ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Has this ever happened to you?? and what can you do when ...
ygData.msgSnippet: Depends on what all is camped and how many ppl are around. I don t see a problem with holding multiple camps if no one is around trying to find one, but it s a
ygData.messageBody:
Depends on what all is camped and how many ppl are around. I don't see a problem with holding multiple camps if no one is around trying to find one, but it's a bit annoying when someone else wants it.
----- Original Message -----
From: Nefrahari@...
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, August 21, 2003 11:00 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Has this ever happened to you?? and what can you do when ...

Speaking of... what do you guys think of camping two camps at once? I ran into a guy doing this the other night... he would kill everything in one camp then run to the other and kill everything then run back again... and yet was claiming both as camped... As far as I'm concerned once you leave your camp, it's fair game... But he was being a jerk about it and I didn't feel like dealing with it so I just logged for the night.
 
In a message dated 8/21/2003 7:45:26 PM Eastern Standard Time, suceress@... writes:
The only time I have moved in on a camp that someone else was at was when a
lvl 65 was claiming the entire undead section of lower guk and I wanted to
hunt there for xp.
 
"Sail to your heart's desires, and know when to drop anchor."
